title: Long Time Player, Rito made us Leave
body: Hey there, I've enjoyed this game since season 1. But as of now the situation of the game is incredibly snowbally (remember that random ass turret nerf so now they're free bags of gold to help snowballing) and not enjoyable. It's making the community more toxic and no one wanted the reworks rito made. In addition to that all the new champs are all mini game champs and i don't really feel like playing mario party. Also everyone build paths have been made identical and low risk/ high reward mobility champs like yas, fizz, yi, etc... have seemingly no weak points when built tank. High mobility tanks are op and rito just keeps buffing tank items they like. As a long time player the game has lost it's luster and I will no longer be playing.

Riot also says they want this to be an e-sport and a 'way of life'.

Older players (myself included) take issue with a lot of these big changes and are leaving in droves, so it matters. If people don't want to stay because they keep messing with what works. then they have a problem

i think its mostly them oversimplifying the game. back when mechanics and game knowledge mattered, was when it was most fun. They want to appeal to casuals so they removed the difficulty of things like timing combos, jungle clearing, buff timers, stutter steppping.....they made the game so fucking noob friendly, its a disgrace.

It's about eliminating unnecessary difficulty and clunky mechanics.  The difficulties of the game should be related the game itself, not the UI and how much bookkeeping you put the effort into doing (ie. jungle timers).

What Riot is trying to do is put every player in the same boat - your experience comes from game knowledge, mechanical skill with a champion and decision making. That's something they feel it's paramount to keep as this is proof of your overall skill a a player.

What they did was eliminate every other secondary system that was additionally complicating the learning process, like learning the language of the League itself - the use of chat abbreviations and timing camps that came out of good habbit.
So, we've came to Smart Pings and Jungle Timers. They also cleaned up UI in order to clearly indicate what is happening on your screen and did the same for champions and effects.
They've cut Leveling by half, to make sure new players don't spend an eternity leveling their accounts, both T2 and T3 runes are super cheap and who knows what other kinds of optimizations they can make in the future.

Quite frankly, i feel League is becoming very receptive of new-ish players, not just pampering the old timers like myself (7 years and counting) who are used to heavy grinding for a single 6300 IP champion that was coming out, still not having a single rune under my belt.

##This is something i do enjoy seeing and i like that Riot is trying to reach out to more players of various skill levels and gaming backgrounds.
##This isn't just my game, this should be everyone's game.
